section.title: Install and configure the controller node for Debian
section.para: This section describes how to install and configure the proxy service that handles requests for the account, container, and object services operating on the storage nodes. For simplicity, this guide installs and configures the proxy service on the controller node. However, you can run the proxy service on any node with network connectivity to the storage nodes. Additionally, you can install and configure the proxy service on multiple nodes to increase performance and redundancy. For more information, see the Deployment Guide.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: The proxy service relies on an authentication and authorization mechanism such as the Identity service. However, unlike other services, it also offers an internal mechanism that allows it to operate without any other OpenStack services. Before you configure the Object Storage service, you must create service credentials and an API endpoint.

note.para: The Object Storage service does not use an SQL database on the controller node. Instead, it uses distributed SQLite databases on each storage node.

step.para: Source the admin credentials to gain access to admin-only CLI commands:
To create the Identity service credentials, complete these steps:

listitem.screen: $ openstack user create --domain default --password-prompt swift User Password: Repeat User Password: +-----------+----------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +-----------+----------------------------------+ | domain_id | default | | enabled | True | | id | d535e5cbd2b74ac7bfb97db9cced3ed6 | | name | swift | +-----------+----------------------------------+

listitem.para: Add the admin role to the swift user:
listitem.screen: $ openstack role add --project service --user swift admin

$ openstack service create --name swift \ --description "OpenStack Object Storage" object-store +-------------+----------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +-------------+----------------------------------+ | description | OpenStack Object Storage | | enabled | True | | id | 75ef509da2c340499d454ae96a2c5c34 | | name | swift | | type | object-store | +-------------+----------------------------------+

note.para: Default configuration files vary by distribution. You might need to add these sections and options rather than modifying existing sections and options. Also, an ellipsis (...) in the configuration snippets indicates potential default configuration options that you should retain.

step.screen: # apt-get install swift swift-proxy python-swiftclient \ python-keystoneclient python-keystonemiddleware \ memcached

note.para: Complete OpenStack environments already include some of these packages.
